fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17064].
  {panel}

When removing a page I get this message:

bq. There are 0 incoming link(s) to this page. These links will be broken when this page is removed. 

Sorry, which links will be broken?
This should read something like:
bq. There are 0 incoming link(s) to this page. This page is safe to remove. 
or just
bq. There are 0 incoming link(s) to this page.

Also the link to the info page is useful if there are some incoming links, but questionable when there are none.
fields.summary: Improve message when deleting a page with 0 incoming links

fields.description:
Since Confluence 2.10ish, the Confluence editor has provided updates about draft saving, including a red error message when drafts cannot be saved due to server issues.  

The full-screen mode of the Rich Text Editor does not display the status messages, so there is no way for users to know whether their drafts are succeeding or failing.  This leads to, or exacerbates issues such as CONF-16961 and CONF-9934.

The full-screen editor needs to have the draft status message, or else users can lose their work.

It might be worth investigating how valuable the full-screen editor actually is, or whether it could be removed.
fields.summary: Full screen editor does not display draft status

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce

# Use any supported Word Processor to create a file
# Create a table with an auto-numbered lists spread across a number of rows under one column. (please see screenshot for a more accurate example)
# Import this file to Confluence using the Doc Import feature
# The sequence of the list is broken, and replaced with number 1 for all of the rows

Attached is a [screenshot|^importdoc_autonumbered.png] of the problem and a [sample file|^autonumberedBug.doc] to reproduce this bug.

h5. Workaround
# Manually enter the numbers in the field rather than using the auto-numbered feature
fields.summary: Autonumbering within a table is broken when used with Doc Import

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce

# Use any supported Word Processor to create a file
# Create a table with an auto-numbered lists spread across a number of rows under one column. (please see screenshot for a more accurate example)
# Use the \{viewfile} macro to include this file in Confluence
# The auto-numbered list is not rendered.

Attached is a [screenshot|^viewfile_autonumbered.png] of the problem and a [sample file|^autonumberedBug.doc] to reproduce this bug.

h5. Workaround
# Manually enter the numbers in the field rather than using the auto-numbered feature
fields.summary: Auto-numbered list in a table in Word document not displayed when using the {viewfile} macro

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce

# This bug is pretty tricky to be reproduced, therefore I have attached the [problematic file|^numberTest.doc]
# Use Open Office Writer to create a file
# Create a list of items using Open Office Writer auto-numbered feature as the contents
# Create a table with some empty cell(s) as the contents
# Import this file to Confluence using the Doc Import feature
# The following error message will be thrown:
{code}
The selected file is not a valid binary Word 97-2003 document
{code}

h5. Findings
# The file can be imported successfully if:
#* There are no empty cells in the table 
#* Auto-numbered feature is not used
#* There are some contents in between the list and table  
# Using the viewfile macro, the page is displayed fine
# Using Microsoft Word to reproduce the problem failed, therefore the issue is specific to Open Office.

h5. Workaround
# Use Microsoft Word or \{viewfile} macro
fields.summary: Unable to import Open Office Document to Confluence due to some contents

fields.description:
Our long term goal is to serve the scripts at the bottom of the page.

However, if we enable javascripts to be served at the bottom of the page by default (see CONF-12329), plugins with inline scripts may break. For 3.1 we will still serve the scripts in the header with an admin option - Serve scripts in header which will be turned ON by default.

This admin option will then be turned OFF by default for 3.2. If plugins still have inline scripts when 3.2 is released, customers can turn back on this admin config to get the plugin to work again.
fields.summary: Add admin config to serve javascript in the header

fields.summary: Cannot build milestones outside Atlassian due to coherence

fields.description:
Currently the office connector views the files, and provides a link to edit the document (say the excel version) at the top of the viewing window.  If you click on the link you get to edit the document directly though webdav, and save directly back to the server.  Very nice!

It would be great if the macro could support just editing directly and skip viewing.  If this was possible you could use something like the reporting macros to produce a list of attachments to a page.  Then you could use that same report to provide an "edit" link directly on the report.  Users would be able to easily browse and edit attachments directly on the server.  No replacing attachments or anything of the sort.  

You sort-of have this support with the editinwordlink macro, but thats only with word.  Why not all the office attachments?  We have a greater need for the editing of excel documents, and the only way we can do it right now is to allow the document to be viewed, then click on the link that is displayed above the macro window of the viewing spreadsheet.
fields.summary: Allow for the direct editing of ANY office attachment (like editinword) to be a macro you can call directly
Page permissions template VM should be loaded via AJAX

fields.description:
As it turns out, there are actually no missing parentheses - its just a misleading error (and a weird quirk in Oracle). 

The actual problem is we should *not* be using ORDER BY inside an IN subquery. That is: 

{noformat}
select * from FOO where BAR in (select ... ORDER BY ...) 
{noformat}

is bad and will produce ORA-00907. 

The order of the collection of values passed to the IN clause should not matter anyway.
fields.summary: Query for determing alternate pages out of a space is failing on oracle with: "ORA-00907 missing right parenthesis"
Disable HSQLDB installation option on EAR/WAR installation

This appears to be similar to CONF-13813, but 2.10.3 appears to already incorporate the fix listed.

fields.description:
The query produces this error: 

{noformat}
[sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions DB2 SQL error: SQLCODE: -134, SQLSTATE: 42907, SQLERRMC: VERSIONC9_
{noformat}

The root cause is that we are doing something like this: {{select DISTINCT p from Page p}}. This is problematic because {{select distinct p}} translates to a SELECT distinct on all the columns of Page which includes the VERSIONCOMMENT clob column. DB2 does not support {{select distinct}} over string values larger than 255 characters (let alone a clob column sized at 10,000). 

Here's the actual explanation of SQLCODE -134 from IBM's documentation: 

{noformat}

SQL0134N
Improper use of a string column, host variable, constant, or function name.
Explanation:

The use of the string name is not permitted.

An expression resulting in a string data type with a maximum length greater than 255 bytes is not permitted in:

    * A SELECT DISTINCT statement
    * A GROUP BY clause
    * An ORDER BY clause
    * A column function with DISTINCT
    * A SELECT or VALUES statement of a set operator other than UNION ALL. 

An expression resulting in a LONG VARCHAR or LONG VARGRAPHIC data type is not permitted in:

    * A predicate other than EXISTS or NULL
    * A column function
    * The SELECT clause of a subquery of a predicate other than EXISTS or NULL
    * The SELECT clause of a subselect in an INSERT statement
    * The value expression of a SET clause in an UPDATE statement unless the expression is a LONG VARCHAR or LONG VARGRAPHIC host variable
    * A SELECT statement of a set operator (except UNION ALL)
    * VARGRAPHIC scalar function. 

Federated system users: in a pass-through session, a data source-specific restriction can cause this error. See the SQL Reference documentation for the failing data sources.

The statement cannot be processed.
User Response:

The requested operation on the string is not supported.
Note:
If it is unclear as to how the 255 byte limit is being exceeded, consider that codepage conversion operations may be required to evaluate the string expression. Depending on the source and target codepages, the target may have a greater length attribute than the source. For more information, refer to the SQL Reference for discussions on string restrictions and string conversions.

sqlcode: -134

sqlstate: 42907

{noformat}
fields.summary: Query to find page alternatives fails on DB2 because we are invoking SELECT DISTINCT on the VERSIONCOMMENT clob column

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

# Make changes using the rich text editor.
# Wait for a draft to save
# Navigate away from the page
# Use the 'back' button in the browser

Notice the changes are lost. This _only_ happens with the rich text editor; in wiki markup, the draft restores. Also note that if the user doesn't use the back button but instead navigates to their drafts, the draft will restore.
fields.summary: Drafts are overwritten when user clicks 'back' button - RTE only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17025].
  {panel}

This is an idea for a new Confluence feature, called "*Albums*".

It could also be known as "Make my own Book", or "Stick Stuff Together" or even "Make Me a Mashup".

*User experience in a nutshell:*
Drag pages into an "album" in your personal profile or in a space. Give the album a name and save it. Add pages, comments, attachments from other Confluence instances. Add JIRA issues. Add other web pages and images. Reorder pages to suit you. Export to PDF or HTML.

*User stories:*
* I'm only interested in specific bits of the company intranet. I want some way of seeing them all in one place. I don't care about the other stuff.
* When I'm wearing my team lead hat, I want to know about these bits. But when I'm wearing my JIRA developer hat, I need to know some entirely different bits.
* I need these bits for a presentation. I want to put them in a specific order, and mix and match just for this presentation.
* I want to give new team members a quick-start guide containing the bits they must get across quickly.
* I want to pull together ideas from different locations and show them to other people. The stuff is all over the place right now - on the web, in our documentation, on our extranet, in our bug tracker. 

Where can I pull all this stuff together? In Confluence, of course.

*Making an album:*

Simplest scenario: Within your Confluence instance, you can:
* Drag or paste pages (links) into a container ("album") in your personal profile or in a space. (Maybe add pages etc also via a browser bookmark, as the social bookmarking plugin does.)
* Save the album, so that you can use it again later.
* View the content of your album - Come back and see what's happened in your album a day later.
* Print the album. This will print the content of all the pages in your album.
* Export the album to PDF or HTML. This will export the content.

Versions:
* Each time you view, print or export, you get the latest version of the pages you've included. The page content is not stored in your album, just the links.
* We could maybe include the option to choose a specific version of a page, blog post or attachment, i.e. to freeze that bit of the album at a specific point in time.

Even nicer scenario: Include other Atlassian products and things other than pages. So you can include the following in your album:
* Confluence attachments (images, Word documents, PDF documents, etc).
* Confluence comments.
* People (profiles).
* Confluence blog posts, and other Confluence content types.
* Pages etc from other Confluence instances, not just the current instance.
* JIRA issues.
* JIRA issue attachments.
* Stuff from other Atlassian apps.

And a cooler scenario yet: Include stuff from the web:
* Images from the web.
* Web pages.

Sooper dooper scenario: As well as providing the view, print and PDF/HTML export, how awesome if you could:
* Include dynamically-updated content from your Confluence-housed album onto your blog or other web site.

Where would you save your album?
* In your Confluence user profile, on a new "Albums" tab.
* In a new "Albums" tab on global spaces.

See further user stories and discussion on the [internal extranet page|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~smaddox/2009/08/15/Idea+for+Confluence+Feature+-+Make+Me+a+Mashup].
fields.summary: Make my own book: Albums or scrapbooks

fields.description:
1. create page "Test Page" in space "Important"
2. add comment to "Test Page" 
2.1 view "Recently Updated" section on space "Important" Home ; comment will be "Re: Test Page"
3. rename page by editing page and changing title to "Important Test Page"
4. view "Recently Updated" section on space "Important" Home ; comment will be called "Re: Important Test Page"
4.1 link is found
5. view "Recently Updated" section on dashboard ; comment will still be called "Re: Test Page" 
5.1 link will be "not found"
fields.summary: Rename Page updates links to comments of that page in space home 'recently updated' but not in dashboard 'recently updated'

fields.description:
In 3.0, a user can only alter page permissions if they have edit permission on that page, as documented [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Restrictions]

With the new Page Permissions dialog, this is no longer the case.  A user with 'restrict' space permission can alter the permissions on pages that they are not allowed to edit.
fields.summary: Page Permissions dialog means that 'Edit' permission is no longer required to alter permissions

fields.description:
Caused by changes in crowd not to return the results in the correct order.
We can solve this by doing a post process on the results pulled from Crowd.
fields.summary: Searches for users are randomly ordered with Crowd version 1.6.2 or greater

fields.description:
Portlet generated by JIRA charting plugin cannot be displayed in Confluence when Trusted Application is setup. Confluence only renders a blank page.

It only renders successfully when the {{os_username os_password}} parameters are used:
{code}
http://localhost:8088/secure/RunPortlet.jspa?portletKey=com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:singlefieldpie&projectOrFilterId=filter-10000&statistictype=statuses&os_username=username&os_password=password
{code}

No error in the log files.

Other portlets can be rendered successfully with/without the {{os_username os_password}} parameters.
fields.summary: jira charting plugin cannot be displayed in jiraportlet macro due to trusted apps

fields.description:
This only affects the macro when trying to pdf-export the page containing jiraportlet from [JIRA charting plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Charting+Plugin].

The error can be seen from the [attached screenshot|^session_expired.PNG]. No other error reported in the log files.

Other JIRA portlets can be pdf-exported fine.
fields.summary: JIRA portlet macro failed to be exported in PDF with error session has already expired

fields.description: As part of a refactor to move the existing Page Permissions editor into a dialog that could appear on various screens, a number of people expressed a desire to rethink the design.

fields.description: Please investigate removing references to the deprecated Confluence repository macros. (Check their inclusion in the macro browser for Confluence 3.0 and 3.1.) Please liaise with Jonathan Nolen. See [PAC-319|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PAC-319].
fields.summary: Remove references to plugin repository macros in the documentation

fields.description:
This code is allowed

{code}
#!/usr/bin/env ruby -wKU

require "xmlrpc/client"

server = XMLRPC::Client.new("localhost","/rpc/xmlrpc",8080)

token = server.call("confluence1.login","admin","admin")               
session=server.proxy("confluence1",token)
#Grab a page
page=session.getPage("ds","home") 
#Blank the title
page["title"]=""
#store the page
session.storePage(page)                                                                  
{code}
fields.summary: Remote API allows you to define a page with null title

fields.description:
When customers are looking for a solution to automatically add LDAP users to the confluence-users group we give them this link:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Automatically+Add+LDAP+users+to+the+confluence-users+Group

The problem with this authenticator is that it will actually put any authenticated user (LDAP and local) into the confluence-users group.  It would be nice if the authenticator limited itself to only work with LDAP users or only local users.
fields.summary: Improve the ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator such that it only adds authenticated LDAP users to the confluence-users group

fields.description:
*Updated description*
The 'database is being updated' cluster panic messages frequency have increased in frequency. The problem seems to be associated specifically to 3.0.1. It doesn't seem to be the result of the [usual suspects|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Database+is+being+updated+by+an+instance+which+is+not+part+of+the+current+cluster].

It might still make sense to separate out the types of cluster panics and address the error handling along with addressing what appears to be a bug.

*Old request* 
The "Database is being updated by an instance which is not part of the current cluster" message is getting too convoluted. It's happening more often on non-clustered instances. The [knowledge base article|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Database+is+being+updated+by+an+instance+which+is+not+part+of+the+current+cluster] describes the situation.

The request here would be to handle this problem a bit better.

# For network failures in a cluster, throw this error as expected.
# In a single-node distribution, disable the cluster safety mechanism. 
## have different error handling around 2 nodes connecting to the database simultaneously.
## For an unresponsive database or hung application server, throw yet a third message. This may be unnecessary, as these situations tend to be deadlocks or Out Of Memory problems; perhaps it's a separate request altogether to be self-aware of performance problems during expensive garbage collection.
fields.summary: Address frequency of cluster panic errors
distribution should include parallel garbage collector
Improve last login date field for better metrics available from database level

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce, 

# Upload an pjpeg image to Confluence page, for eg [this one|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/33336/BabyWebNZ_T-Shirt_Purple.jpg]
# Embed it into a page as thumbnail 
{code}!BabyWebNZ_T-Shirt_Purple.jpg|thumbnail!{code}
# Save the page
# Edit the page in Rich Text - confluence will not load the wiki markup for the image as it can't generate thumbnail
# Save page and the wikimarkup for the thumbnail image is lost.
fields.summary: Wiki markup content is deleted when editing/saving an unsupported thumbnail format

fields.description:
How to replicate:

* Using Safari, take the wiki markup below and insert it into a page in wiki markup. 
* Switch to the Rich Text Editor
* Copy and paste the list within the page. 
* Switch back to Wiki Markup
* See how the link markup was broken.

If there are more links and more bulletpoints, the list syntax will break as well.

{code:title=original markup}
* A point with a link ([http://google.com])
* A second Point
{code}

{code:title=broken markup}
* A point with a link ({color:#003366}[{color:#003366}http://google.com{color}|http://google.com]{color})
* A second Point
{code}
fields.summary: Copying a bullet list with links in the WYSIWYG Editor breaks the markup in Safari

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16975].
  {panel}

The database setup guides could use some TLC. The pressing need here is that each specific setup guide needs instructions on how to set up a DB backup strategy, as we're really pushing external db strategies even more than before.

In addition:
* (/) Sybase instructions should be removed; it's not supported
* (/) Creating Database Schema Manually is an FAQ
* (/) Known Issues For Supported Databases should be migrated to the KB. Where appropriate, necessary up-front configurations should be integrated straight into the setup guides
* The setup guides should get a standard look and feel. 
** DB setup on Oracle is JNDI only
** DB setup on Postgres has screenshots, everything else doesn't, and it's Windows only
* (/) Database Setup Guides is an unnecessary placeholder
* (/) Database Setup for Oracle (Pre Confluence 2.2) should be deprecated (deleted)
* (/) Database JDBC drivers should be integrated into the main setup docs (_Have tidied up the page, and cross-linked to relevant content. There's some value in listing the status of the db drivers on one page._)
* (/) Troubleshooting External Database Connections - move to KB (_Have tidied up the page, and moved relevant content to KB._)
* (/) Troubleshooting the Embedded Database (hSQL DB) - move to KB (_Have tidied up the page, and moved relevant content to KB._)
* (/) Upgrading From HSQL 1.7.1 to 1.8 should be deprecated
fields.summary: Revamp database setup guides

fields.description:
For both [contentbylabel macro|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Content+by+Label+Macro#ContentbyLabelMacro-Parameters] and [blog-posts macro|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Blog+Posts+Macro#BlogPostsMacro-Parameters], the docs say that you can specify one or more authors, separated by a comma or a space.

The claim is also repeated in the Macro Browser text.

However, using a space as a separator does *not* work.

Either it should, or the text needs to be changed.

fields.description:
After upgrading from 2.10.2 to 3.0.1, a particular LDAP user no longer has any permissions from group membership, despite still being displayed a member of various groups. All other users (as far as we know) are unaffected. The user also cannot be removed from groups. When trying, no error is displayed, but the user remains in the group.

The problem can be worked around by adding the user to the groups they already show up as being in. When added in this way, the user appears twice in the group membership list, and regains the correct permissions.

One of the two users can then be removed from the group - it doesn't seem to matter whether one chooses the first or the second.
fields.summary: After upgrade from 2.10.2, LDAP user's group membership doesn't work right

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16945].
  {panel}

It would be nice if a user can see all pages on which someone references him in the wiki.

e.g. 

someone uses this syntax [~greg]

then Greg could use a macro e.g.

{incoming-links:ownspace} and see those pages.

For security rights a standard user can only show this pages for himself not for others.

fields.description:
# use "doc import" function to import & split a docx file that contains at least two identical headings at the same level of the document
# As expected, the doc import function will auto-rename the page titles for the identical headings to prevent conflict 
** e.g. Two headings both titled "Subheading" were split into pages tiled "Subheading" & "Subheading0" here: [https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/display/DOCXIMPORT/Title]
# Change some content in the docx file, but not the headings and re-import it to the same location with the "Imported pages become new versions of existing pages with the same title" option selected.
# Pages with auto-renamed titles only have one version in their history, but the other non-renamed pages have all versions as expected. All pages should have correct version history.
** Compare page history for ["Subheading"|https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/pages/viewpreviousversions.action?pageId=1770193281] with ["Subheading0"|https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/pages/viewpreviousversions.action?pageId=1770193282] after importing the docx file twice.
fields.summary: Word 2007 support : doc import does not maintain version history when imported pages are set to become new versions of existing pages with the same title AND the page title is auto-renamed because of conflict
